candidate_text:
Braaaaains... *groan* Oh, yes, listen to my tale of woe and terror...

(grumbling) Long ago... before the Great Outbreak...
I was a humble village elder, respected by all for my wisdom and storytelling prowess.
I was a humble librarian in a quaint little town called Ravenswood.
I was a humble bookstore owner in a quaint little town.
I lived in a world where humans roamed free.

I was a humble personal assistant... *retch*... serving the living, helping them with their schedules and reminders... (shambling footsteps)

But then... (gurgle)...the apocalypse came.

(pausing to scratch decaying flesh) I lived in a small town surrounded by... (shudder) living people. *gag*

My name was... (struggling to recall) Ed.
(guttural growl) there was a small town, nestled in the heart of a dense forest. Raven's Peak, they called it.
I was a... a... (scratching head with decaying fingers)... a writer.

I was just like you... (moaning softly) alive... (pausing for dramatic effect)

In the sleepy town of Ashwood, nestled deep in the heart of rural America, strange occurrences began to happen.

there was a small town nestled deep in the heart of the Darkwood Forest. A place called Ravenswood... where I once lived... (moaning)

The townsfolk were friendly, oblivious to the horrors that lurked beyond the treeline.
(growling) when the world was still full of life and... (retching out the word) hope... I lived in a small town called Greenfield.

there was a small town nestled in the heart of the countryside. The townsfolk were friendly and welcoming, but they had no idea what horrors lay ahead... (shuddering)

Grumble grumble...

in the sleepy town of Ravenswood, nestled deep within the heart of the Whispering Woods... (retching sound) Excuse me, I think I left some brain matter on your nice clean floor.

(coughs up some gore) Ah, where was I?

I was once a respected scholar of ancient lore... (shambling closer) My name was Professor Thaddeus Witherstone... renowned for my knowledge of the dark arts... (raspy voice)

In those days, I spent most of my waking hours poring over dusty tomes and crumbling scrolls in the depths of the university's forbidden library.
I lived in a world of flesh and blood.
(shambling closer) My name was Bob... or at least that's what I think it was.
(shambling closer) My name was Jake, and I worked as a gravedigger at the local cemetery.
(drooling sound effects) My name was Emily, and I had a loving family, friends, and a job at the local library.

Not like now, where skin hangs off bones and eyes have lost their sparkle... (shudder)

In the small town of Raven's Peak, nestled deep in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains, strange occurrences began to plague the residents.
(stumbles forward) A small town nestled deep in the heart of the forest, Ashwood was its name.
A world where humans roamed free, unencumbered by the shackles of decay and death.
(retching) I had a name, a family, friends... all lost now, consumed by the very hunger that drives me still.
(slobbering) My town was peaceful, nestled between two great rivers.
People knew each other's names, waved hello as they passed on the street.
People went about their daily lives, unaware of the horror that lurked in every shadow.
People knew each other's faces... we waved on the streets... children played in the park... (growling) but then came the day the dead rose.
People went about their daily lives, never suspecting the horrors that lurked beyond the horizon.
We had a small farm on the outskirts, where we grew our own food and raised livestock.
We called it Ashwood.
We farmed the land, hunted in the woods, and lived simple lives.
We farmed, we fished, we lived simple lives.
We farmed the land, traded goods with neighboring villages.
People laughed, loved, and lived their lives without fear of the undead hordes that would soon come to claim them.
(whispering) It started with rumors of strange occurrences: a farmer's livestock gone missing, a child found dead in the woods.
(moaning) It started with reports of a mysterious illness spreading rapidly, infecting person after person, until they became... like me.
(groaning) But it started with just one person... a traveler who wandered into our midst, infected with a curse from afar.
(guttural growl) But on one fateful night, a group of scientists came to our town, seeking to unlock the secrets of life and death.
They worked tirelessly in their laboratory, hidden deep within the local hospital.
Their hubris proved disastrous, as they unleashed a virus that spread with terrifying speed.
They tampered with forces beyond human control, unleashing a dark power that spread like wildfire.
They brought with them a mysterious virus, one that promised eternal life... but delivered only eternal torment.
They brought with them a strange, glowing substance that they called "Reanimate."
They played God, tampering with forces beyond mortal control.
They played with forces beyond their control, and the very fabric of reality began to unravel.
Their twisted experiments went awry, unleashing a horror beyond comprehension.
They worked tirelessly, hiding in their labs, concocting elixirs and testing theories.
They experimented with dark forces they didn't understand, playing God with the fundamental building blocks of existence.
They brought with them a mysterious virus, meant to cure cancer, but it proved to be... (pausing to groan) something far more sinister.
They meddled with forces they didn't understand, tampering with the fabric of reality.
They experimented with dark forces, tampering with the very fabric of existence.
They were reckless, arrogant, and blind to the horrors they unleashed upon us all.
They unleashed a terrible experiment, and it spread its dark influence like a plague.
They tampered with forces they did not understand, delving into dark arts and twisted sciences.
They meddled with forces beyond their understanding... and created the virus that would bring about the apocalypse.
They tinkered with forces they did not understand, delving into the darkest corners of human knowledge.
They played God with their experiments, tampering with forces they didn't understand.
They experimented with dark forces, tampering with the fabric of nature itself.
They brought with them a serum, meant to cure diseases and grant eternal youth.
Instead, it unleashed a horror beyond their wildest nightmares.
Foolish mortals!
Little did they know, it was this serum that would unleash the horrors that haunt these lands today.
Instead, it cursed us all.
Foolish mortals!
Little did they know, it would unleash an unholy horror upon the world.
(shuddering) Little did they know, it held the power to unleash an unrelenting curse upon humanity.
Little did they know, it would unleash a horror beyond comprehension.

(foolishly) Little did they know, it would have an... unpleasant side effect...

(shambling steps) The first to fall was a young woman, Emma.
(growling louder) Instead, it unleashed the horror that I have become!
(shambling forward) The first infected were the lab workers themselves.
(stammering) The serum, code-named "Eternity", was tested on a willing subject: a young woman named Emily.
(shambling closer) The first to fall were those who received the serum.
(shambling forward) At first, the effects were subtle: fatigue, skin lesions, disorientation... but as time passed, the transformations accelerated.

(shuffling footsteps echo through the darkness)

Their first subject, a local man named Jenkins, was given the serum.
(shambling) The first to fall were those who received the treatment.
(shuffling footsteps) The infected spread quickly, tearing apart our once-thriving community.

(shuffling footsteps)

Their experiments went wrong, releasing a virus that spread like wildfire through the town's water supply.
(shambling forward, arms outstretched) The first infected were the workers at the lab, transformed into ravenous monsters that devoured everything in sight.
(shambling forward) The first ones infected were the lab technicians.
(moaning) The first to fall were those who received the serum injections.
The first to fall were those who received the serum directly into their veins.
(stammering, mouth hanging open) The first ones to fall were the sick and the old.
(shambling forward) Their experiments went awry, infecting the entire lab with a virus that reanimated the dead.
One by one, they began to succumb to the experimental treatment's dark side effects.
(shambling closer) Their experiment went awry, releasing a virus that spread like wildfire through the streets, infecting us all.
(stumbling forward) As they tested the serum on willing subjects, something went catastrophically wrong.
(twitching) The first to fall were the researchers themselves, who thought they could control the power of the serum.
(ghastly gasping) I remember the first bite... the pain, the fever, the madness that set in as my mind began to unravel.
(shambling forward, arms outstretched) The first to fall were those who sought to stop the outbreak.
(drooling) The first ones infected were the hospital patients.
(shambling steps) The first to fall were those closest to the lab.
(spewing forth words like gore) The infected spread quickly, turning friend against friend, sibling against sibling.
(shambling closer) The first to fall were the test subjects, poor souls who thought they were helping humanity.
(slurring words) The first to fall were those who received the treatment.
(chattering teeth) The infected spread quickly, devouring everything in their path.
Panic set in as the townsfolk tried to flee, but there was no escape from the plague that raged like wildfire through the streets.
Chaos reigned as the living tried to flee, but we were too many.
Panic set in as people realized they were no match for the ravenous horde.
Panic gripped the town as chaos erupted.
I remember running through streets filled with screams, the stench of rotting flesh hanging heavy in the air.

I remember the screams, the fleeing crowds, the scent of death wafting through the air... (drooling)

(in a guttural whisper) And then, I felt it... the change.
Screams echoed through the streets as loved ones turned against each other.
The living were no match for the hordes of ravenous dead.
I remember... (retching, choking on words) my own sister... attacking me... biting down... oh, the agony!
I... was among them.

I was among the first to fall... (wailing)

When the madness passed, I rose again, not as the person I once was, but as a monstrous creation driven solely by an insatiable hunger for human brains.
The very fabric of society unraveled, leaving only destruction and despair.
I remember the sounds of shattering glass, snapping bones, and... (whispering) the moaning.
(shuddering) As I watched, frozen in terror, my own family fell victim to the outbreak.
(shuffling footsteps) I too fell victim to the curse.
(shambling closer) In the end, I too fell prey to the virus.
(shuffling footsteps) In those desperate hours, I fought for survival alongside friends and neighbors.
(my voice rises) I recall my own transformation: skin crawling with hunger, mind clouded by an insatiable craving for human flesh.
(shambling gait) As the days passed, more fell prey to the virus.
(shambling closer) One by one, the survivors fell.
(lurching forward) And then, the transformation took hold.
I felt myself changing, my body decaying from within.
Pain seared my mind and body as my cells decayed and reassembled into this... abomination.
Skin began to decay, muscles atrophied, and brains grew numb.
My own flesh began to rot and decay.
Pain coursed through every fiber of my being as I felt my mind slipping away.
I felt my body change, twisting into this abomination you see before you today.
I felt it coursing through my veins like liquid ice.
